meanings.definition: To occur or exist at a later time than something else.
meanings.sent1: The meeting will postdate the training session.
meanings.sent2: I always postdate my appointments in my calendar.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if breakfast postdated lunch!
meanings.sent4: Her success seemed to postdate all her previous failures.
meanings.sent5: The sunset postdated the storm, painting the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To write a date on a document that is later than the actual date.
meanings.sent1: She decided to postdate the check for next week.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal to postdate official documents.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally postdated my birthday card to my friend.
meanings.sent4: His signature seemed to postdate the rest of the document.
meanings.sent5: The letter was postdated to create a false impression of timeliness.

meanings.definition: To assign a date to something that is later than the actual date of occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist had to postdate the artifact due to new evidence.
meanings.sent2: Historians often postdate events to fit their narratives.
meanings.sent3: It would be strange to postdate a historical event to the future!
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature postdated the completion of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to postdate the discovery after further research revealed the true timeline.
